metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the win-def:activedirectory_test probe is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the win-def:activedirectory_test probe.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.
Information regarding the active directory on your particular machine can be found by navigating to Start->Run... and type 'ldp'.

criterion.comment: Test that an activedirectory_object with only a naming_context is supported.
Test that an activedirectory_object with a naming_context and a relative_dn is supported.
Test that an activedirectory_object with a naming_context and a relative_dn and attribute is supported.
Test that an activedirectory_object with a naming_context and a relative_dn where a pattern match is used and attribute is supported.
Test that an activedirectory_object with a naming_context and a relative_dn and attribute pattern match is used is supported.

activedirectory_test.comment: Test that an activedirectory_object with only a naming_context is supported.
Test that an activedirectory_object with a naming_context and a relative_dn is supported.
Test that an activedirectory_object with a naming_context and a relative_dn and attribute is supported.
Test that an activedirectory_object with a naming_context and a relative_dn where a pattern match is used and attribute is supported.
Test that an activedirectory_object with a naming_context and a relative_dn and attribute pattern match is used is supported.

activedirectory_object.comment: Retrieve the active directory object with the naming_context equal to 'domain'.
Retrieve the active directory object with the naming_context equal to 'domain' and the relative_dn equal to 'CN=HRDept,CN=Users'.
Retrieve the active directory object with the naming context equal to 'domain', the relative distinguished name equal to 'CN=HRDept,CN=Users', and the attribute equal to 'description'.

Retrieve active directory objects with the naming context equal to 'domain', the relative distinguished name matches the regular expression 'CN=HR[a-zA-Z]*,CN=Users', and the attribute equals 'description'.
Retrieve active directory objects with the naming context 'domain', the relative distinguished name 'CN=HRDept,CN=Users', and an attribaute that matches the regular expression 'descrip.*'.

activedirectory_state.comment: This state represents an Active Directory object that has a naming context of 'domain'.
This state represents an Active Directory object that has a naming context of 'domain' and a relative_dn of 'CN=HRDept,CN=Users'.

This state represents an Active Directory object that has a naming context of 'domain', a relative distinguished name of 'CN=HRDept,CN=Users', an attribute 'description', an object class of 'top;group;', an ads type of 'ADSTYPE_CASE_IGNORE_STRING', and a value of 'HRDept Employees'.

This state represents an Active Directory object that has a naming context of 'domain', a relative distinguished name that matches the regular expression '.*', an attribute of 'description', an object class of 'top;group;', an ads type of 'ADSTYPE_CASE_IGNORE_STRING', and a value that matches the regular expression '.*'.

This state represents an Active Directory object that has a naming context of 'domain', a relative distinguished name of 'CN=HRDept,CN=Users', an attribute that matches the regular expression '.*', an object class of 'top;group;', an ads type of 'ADSTYPE_CASE_IGNORE_STRING', and a value of 'HRDept Employees'.
